text: The men's lightweight double sculls competition at the 2019 World Rowing Championships took place at the Linz-Ottensheim regatta venue. A top-seven finish ensured qualification for the Tokyo Olympics. ==Schedule== The schedule was as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! Date ! Time ! Round |- | Sunday 25 August 2019 || 10:56 || Heats |- | Monday 26 August 2019 || 12:17 || Repechages |- | rowspan=2|Wednesday 28 August 2019 || 11:37 || Quarterfinals |- | 16:58 || Semifinals E/F |- | rowspan=4|Thursday 29 August 2019 || 10:42 || Semifinals A/B |- | 16:30 || Semifinals C/D |- | 17:10 || Final F |- | 17:25 || Final E |- | Saturday 31 August 2019 || 09:45 || Final D |- | rowspan=3|Sunday 1 September 2019 || 10:03 || Final C |- | 11:24 || Final B |- | style=background:lemonchiffon| 13:54 ||style=background:lemonchiffon| Final A |} All times are Central European Summer Time (UTC+2) ==Results== ===Heats=== The three fastest boats in each heat advanced directly to the quarterfinals. The remaining boats were sent to the repechages. ====Heat 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Stefano Oppo ===Repechages=== The two fastest boats in each repechage advanced to the quarterfinals. The remaining boats were sent to the E/F semifinals. ====Repechage 1==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Bayram Sönmez Enes Yenipazarlı | align="left"| | 6:38.48 | Q |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Petros Gkaidatzis Antonios Papakonstantinou | align="left"| | 6:40.69 | Q |- | 3 | align="left"|Arvind Singh Bhagwan Singh | align="left"| | 6:44.98 | SE/F |- | 4 | align="left"|Evgeniy Agafonov Shakhzod Nurmatov | align="left"| | 6:45.99 | SE/F |- | 5 | align="left"|Yevgeniy Tatsei Daniil Savchenko | align="left"| | 7:00.35 | SE/F |} ====Repechage 2==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Kristoffer Brun Are Strandli | align="left"| | 6:33.19 | Q |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Peter Zelinka Marek Reznak | align="left"| | 6:44.05 | Q |- | 3 | align="left"|Aleksandr Bogdashin Alexandr Tufanyuk | align="left"| | 6:46.18 | SE/F |- | 4 | align="left"|Mohamed Kota Ahmed Abdelaal | align="left"| | 6:58.79 | SE/F |} ====Repechage 3==== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Rank !Rowers !Country !Time !Notes |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 1 | align="left"|Andrew Campbell Nicholas Trojan | align="left"| | 6:38.17 | Q |-bgcolor=ccffcc | 2 | align="left"|Yuki Ikeda Mitsuo Nishimura | align="left"| | 6:41.03 | Q |- | 3 | align="left"|Chan Chi- fung Wong Wai-chun | align="left"| | 6:51.85 | SE/F |- | 4 | align="left"|Edgar Ilas Cris Nievarez | align="left"| | 6:58.41 | SE/F |- | 5 | align="left"|Marjan Nikolovski Marjan Vlakjeski | align="left"| | 7:33.49 | SE/F |} ===Quarterfinals=== The three fastest boats in each quarter advanced to the A/B semifinals.
